question_sentence: Hurricane Idalia made landfall Wednesday in which state?
evidence: Idalia made landfall as a powerful Category 3 hurricane on Florida’s Gulf Coast, inflicting deadly storm surge and catastrophic winds not seen in that area in 125 years.

question_sentence: How many astronauts recently arrived at the International Space Station?
evidence: A SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts from four different countries docked Sunday at the International Space Station. They joined seven astronauts already on the orbiting laboratory.

question_sentence: Which decorated gymnast recently won a record eighth all-around national title?
evidence: Simone Biles’ impressive eighth national title this week broke the record she shared with Alfred Jochim, who won his seventh all-around gold medal 90 years ago in 1933.

question_sentence: Which airline received a massive fine for keeping passengers waiting on planes during lengthy tarmac delays?
evidence: American Airlines received a $4.1 million fine from the Department of Transportation for extended tarmac delays that impacted thousands of travelers over the past few years.

question_sentence: After a 35-year run, which department store closed its downtown San Francisco location due to a spike in retail theft?
evidence: Nordstrom closed its five-story department store in San Francisco, citing challenging operating conditions “which have led to declines in sales, occupancy and foot traffic.”

question_sentence: Which 2024 Republican presidential candidate was asked to stop using Eminem’s rap songs on the campaign trail?
evidence: Vivek Ramaswamy was asked to stop singing Eminem’s lyrics at campaign events after he gave an impromptu karaoke rendition of “Lose Yourself” at the Iowa State Fair.

question_sentence: What percentage of people in the US have some immunity to Covid-19?
evidence: Approximately 97% of people in the US have some immunity to Covid-19 through vaccination, infection or both, according to the CDC. However, health experts still recommend updating your vaccines as coronavirus strains continue to morph.

question_sentence: Which substance is being reviewed for possible reclassification in the US as a lower-risk drug?
evidence: A senior official at the US Department of Health and Human Services has called for easing restrictions on marijuana by reclassifying it as a Schedule III substance. Marijuana is currently classified as a Schedule I controlled substance — meant for the most dangerous substances, including heroin and LSD.

question_sentence: Which college sport set a world record for attendance this week?
evidence: Over 92,000 people attended the University of Nebraska women’s volleyball match against Omaha — setting a world record for the largest announced crowd at a women’s sporting event.

question_sentence: Apple is widely expected to unveil the latest version of which product in the coming days?
evidence: The iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro will likely be unveiled at a special event on September 12. Some of the rumored upgrades include new colors, better battery performance and a switch from Apple’s proprietary lightning connector to the USB-C.

question_sentence: What is the planned development across from Helen's Sausage House near Smyrna on Route 13?
choices: A new park and recreational area.

question_sentence: Which Food Network show is Anne Burrell known for and what event did she host for Meals on Wheels in Delaware?
choices: "Iron Chef America"; She hosted a cooking competition for Meals on Wheels.
"Chopped"; She hosted a charity cooking event for Meals on Wheels.
"Worst Cooks in America"; She hosted the 20th annual Celebrity Chefs’ Brunch for Meals on Wheels.
"Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives"; She hosted a food festival for Meals on Wheels.

question_sentence: What is scrapple made from and how is it typically prepared?
choices: Scrapple is made from ground beef and is usually served grilled.
Scrapple is made from leftover pig parts, cornmeal, and flour, then sliced and fried until crispy.
Scrapple is a type of cheese made from curdled milk and is often melted on sandwiches.
Scrapple is a type of seafood dish made from lobster and crab, commonly served at festivals.

question_sentence: When does daylight saving time end in 2023?

In which year did Jourdan Townsend make a significant clutch play by catching a 38-yard touchdown pass just before halftime, leading Delaware to secure the CAA title and end an 8-game losing streak against Villanova?
What is the title of Jodi Johnson's podcast, in which he shares his personal experiences and battles with mental health issues to spread awareness and provide self-help tips?
What is the significance of the term "blue moon" in astronomy?
choices: A blue moon refers to a moon that appears blue in color due to atmospheric conditions.
A blue moon is the first full moon of the year, signifying the start of a new lunar cycle.
A blue moon is the second full moon of a month or the fifth full moon of a season.
A blue moon is a term used to describe a moon that is particularly bright and larger than usual.

question_sentence: Among the following Delaware charter schools, which one ranked highest in the U.S. News & World Report's "2023-2024 Best High Schools" ranking for charter schools nationwide?
What organization owned and occupied the Elwyn building before it was purchased by the Delaware Affordable Housing Group?
Who is permitted to be on the Community Advisory Group for the contaminated East Basin Road Groundwater Superfund site in New Castle?
choices: Residents who reside near the site
